intro: Pedicularis tsiangii, commonly known as the Yunnan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes species that are often parasitic or hemiparasitic. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
